review_title: Fun day and good to meet colleagues from a different Ben location.
pros: I have only worked for Ben for 1 month and I have to say I absolutely love it. It can be hard work but it is very rewarding.
cons: Having lots of different agency staff can have a detrimental effect on the residents. Especially ones who suffer from dementia as they require routine and familiarity,

pros: Ben is a company that truly cares about our residents. The whole team of staff across the centre work together to support the daily living of residents. The care staff are dedicated, friendly and professional and provide person centred care to help our residents have the best quality of life. The home is set in beautiful grounds which are enjoyed by our residents and our new refurbished Houses provide a homely and safe environment for residents.
cons: In my opinion, there are no down sides to working at Town Thorns and think we are only going to go from strength to strength inline with our refurbishment and Best Life Program which is designed to improve the quality of life and experience for our residents and their relatives and will help to ensure we offer a home for life.

pros:
I have worked at town thorns for over 11 years, I worked firstly in the kitchen. Really enjoyed it, I worked with a great team. 
I then moved onto Care in 2016. I have been caring for residents here ever since. I work with an amazing team, everyone is so friendly here. 
Town thorns is a lovely place to work. It speaks for itself with how long I've been here.
cons: I would say the down side is that we never seem to get many new faces through the door. I guess that's due to being out in the sticks. And maybe the fact if you are a mum the hours aren't great or flexible when it comes to child care.

review_title: Lovely home to work at, just a bit outdated
pros: Lovely home with brand new units, friendly staff and the residents are treated with a lot of care.
cons: No eMars! Paper recording during med rounds is tedious and out dated. It may be difficult to take up but once implemented, things will be a lot lot more streamlined.

review_title: Fun, friendly and a bright future!
job_title: Internal Communications Manager in Ascot, England
pros: Ben is so friendly and we all genuinely work hard to improve and support the lives of our service users. It's a unique and positive environment in each organisation area, across Care Services, our Health & Wellbeing support teams and Head Office. We work hard to value and collaborate across the whole of Ben.
cons: There's always opportunities for Ben to grow as an employer, but the team are dedicated to developing themselves and the organisation to the best of their ability.

review_title: Team work makes the dream work
pros: Good values, friendly staff and members. Approachable management.
cons: More pay. Wages are better than most, but this is the trend over the whole care sector not just this company.

job_title: Village Team Member in Sunninghill, England
pros: Friendly staff and great team work
Feel like I am part of a wonderful family.
cons: Out in the sticks, have to use my car to commute

job_title: Head of Care Services in Sunninghill, England
pros: Working for a charitable organisation that genuinely cares about their staff.
Flexible working, Team works hard to support people who come needing support
cons: Policies are outdated and don't support staff so most leave after any life events.

pros: As much as I regret ever stepping through the front door, I have met some lovely people along the way.
cons:
Almost the entire exec team have little to no clue on what they are doing. 
They are incompetent, rude and live in their ivory towers whilst praying for miracles.
The board of trustees consists of old, retired men, who have no idea on how to progress this business (yes, even NFP, this IS a business). They believe that computers should be binned, because they would much rather have a busty blonde make them tea and type their notes. Out of touch with reality.
The entire culture at Ben is based on having meetings for the sake of having meetings, which are, just like this whole organisation, a massive waste of everyone's time.
The consultation about staff's contract changes was an absolute disaster and to be honest, I am extremely surprised that Ben has not been taken to court. 
Management promotes people, who get their nose brown and cannot possibly see their lack of knowledge, qualifications, passion and general tact. People, who are literally mentally unstable and incapable of performing most basic, day-to-day tasks are being kept on board. However, staff that are brilliant and willing to go the extra mile are overlooked for a promotion over and over again till... You guessed it! They leave! 
Salaries of HO are unrealistically high for most,  yet no consequences are being carried out when mistakes are made. 'Oooops. Let's move on.'
I think Ben's philosophy can be best described as 'Let's see how much can we sweep under the carpet without people realising.' 
There were too many instances of disciplinary actions due to discrimination and harassment.  HR always magically sways  in favour of the accused, as they are normally higher up the food chain than the staff filing these. They dismiss them with 'get on with your life' and no further action is taken. If they listened, Ben would have saved themselves some big bucks by getting rid of absolute time wasters years ago. 
Bottom line is that I honestly do not understand how this place is still open. How many lies did you have to tell to do that until now?

review_title: Not that bad to be honest
pros: Easy and friendly but can be tough at times
cons: Too much time  wasted on pointless things

review_title: Good time working there for 2 years
pros: Good environment to work in, lots of friendly people.
cons: Very hard work, need to put your all into it.

pros: You get paid a lot of money
Staff at ground level are lovely but some get away with doing nothing whilst others work their socks off. The culture in the company is poisonous ...
cons: Directors and Management are clueless and just taking extortionate salaries and bonuses
